docs.summary:
The wix-storage module contains functionality for the persistent
 storage of key/value data in the user's browser.
description: There are two types of storage:
+ **Local** — Data in local storage never expires, even if the user closes
your page. When the user reopens the page later, the data can still be
retrieved.
+ **Session** — Data in session storage is available while the user's web
session is active. The session ends when the user closes the browser tab
or window. When the session ends, all the data in session storage is lost.
Reloading or restoring the page does not affect session storage data.
To use the Storage API, import the needed storage type(s) from the
`wix-storage` module:
``` javascript
import {local, session} from 'wix-storage';
// Or one of:
import {local} from 'wix-storage';
import {session} from 'wix-storage';
The APIs in `wix-storage` can only be used in front-end code.
To work with the data in session and local storage use the functions described {@link wix-storage.Storage|here}.
Some older browsers may not fully support `wix-storage`. See
<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Storage#Browser_compatibility" target=_blank>Browser
compatibility for more information.

docs.summary: Used for local storage of data.
description: Use the methods in [`Storage`](wix-storage.Storage.html) to manage `local` data.
